raycasting.message: Raycasting is a method of "drawing" a line from the head of a mob to detect where it looks at. It works by recursively executing a function positioned ^ ^ ^0.1, which make it run 0.1 blocks forward in the direction the mob is looking at. You can generate a raycasting datapack using https://skylinerw.com/vdvman1/raycast/ .

json string.message: As of 1.13, CustomName for entities and item display names (and lore in 1.14) started using JSON text components. They still need to be stored in a string, because NBT cannot store direct JSON. An example looks like this: `"{\"color\":\"blue\",\"text\":\"example\"}"`. If you don't care about colors and formatting and just want plain text, you can use this shortcut: `"\"example\""`. As of 1.14, you can use single quotes `'` around strings to avoid needing to escape double quotes: `'"example"'` and `'{"color":"blue","text":"example"}'`

escaping.message: When you need a string to contain special characters that normally indicate special behaviour for the parser, you need to escape those characters. For example, if you want to put `This is an "example" string` inside a string, you need to escape the quotes to tell the parser that those quotes are part of the string. You do that by preceding the character with a `\`: `"This is an \"example\" string"`. Since 1.14 you can use `'` to surround your string, and then don't need (and also can't) escape the `"`, for example: `{display:{Name:'"This is an example string"'}}`. If you need to have two escaped string inside eachother (for example when making a sign whose command includes `"`) you need to escape the escaping, by replacing `\` with `\\`, for example `{display:{Name:'"This is an \\"example\\" string "'}}` or `{display:{Name:"\"This is an \\\"example\\\" string \""}}`

message: The following area_effect_cloud won't have particles and will last ~6.8 years: ```/summon minecraft:area_effect_cloud ~ ~ ~ {Age:-2147483648,Duration:-1,WaitTime:-2147483648}```

discord formatting.message:
When putting commands (and other code, like json) in Discord, it's wise to put them in code blocks. This makes the command easier to read and stops Discord from removing special characters (like \\). Here are some examples of code blocks:

**Inline code block**
\`example\`
`example`

**Multi-line code block**
\`\`\`example\`\`\`
```example```

**Multi-line code block with language syntax highlighting**
\`\`\`json
{
	"example": true
}
\`\`\`
```json
{
	"example": true
}
```
discord formatting.tags: discord formatting format code block blocks

message: To summon an armorstand with every slot completely disabled use ``/summon minecraft:armor_stand ~ ~ ~ {DisabledSlots:4144959}``
Certain disabled slots combinations do not work as intended: https://bugs.mojang.com/browse/MC-94252
|         |  Hand  |  Boots  | Leggings | Chestplate |  Helmet  | Offhand |  Total  |
(For a disabled slots message in image format, use ``>faq disabled slots``)
disabled slots table.tags: disabledslots slots disabled armor_stand armor stand armorstand

message: `foo` → Specifies the root element's child named `foo`
`list[0]` → Specifies the first element of the child `list`. `list` must be a list or one of the array types
`list[0].child` → Specifies the child `child` of the previous element
`foo."bar with [[weird]] characters"` → Specifies the child named `"bar with [[weird]] characters"`
`list[{flag:1b}]` → Gets each element of `list` with a child named `flag` that has a value of `1b`
`{}` → Specifies the root element of the NBT
`{name:"mcc",cool:1b}` → Specifies the root element if it matches `{name:"mcc",cool:1b}`
`user{name:"sky"}` → Specifies the user element if `user.name` is `"sky"`
